EXTRACTED VALUE: Nets guard Keyon Dooling was inactive on Monday because of a groin injury.
DeShawn Stevenson exercised his player option for the 2010/11 season.
In the five games since Andre Iguodala has returned from a heel injury, Evan Turner is averaging 3.6 points, 2.0 rebounds and 1.4 assists per game.
Jeff Teague had 10 points and six assists in 22 minutes on Wednesday.
The Spurs have signed summer-league standout SG Gary Neal to a three-year guaranteed contract.
The Warriors officially signed Jeremy Lin on Wednesday.
The Heat have traded Chris Quinn to the Nets for a heavily protected 2010 second-round pick, reports ESPN's Marc Stein.
Jordan Crawford dropped in 30 points while going 13-for-20 from the field, including three three-pointers, five rebounds and five assists.
Sebastian Telfair (ankle, foot) missed most of Tuesday's practice.
Coach Doc Rivers said that Delonte West (fractured wrist) is in danger of missing the rest of the regular season.
Mo Williams (groin, thumb) says he is getting closer to 100 percent.
The Bulls have invited guard John Lucas III to training camp with a partially guaranteed contract.
Celtics rookie Avery Bradley continues to rehab his surgically-repaired ankle.
The Mavericks will not re-sign Von Wafer -- his 10-day contract expired following Friday's game.
George Hill left Monday's game in the fourth quarter due to cramps in his right calf.
Lou Williams hit 5-of-13 shots, 6-of-6 free throws and three 3-pointers on his way to 19 points in Friday's win.
Steve Nash is dealing with a groin strain, bruised heel and tweaked back.
Pacers guard A.J. Price (knee) has taken part in almost every minute of training camp this week without restrictions.
Beat writer Shandel Richardson writes that Mario Chalmers (ankle) could be the answer for the team at PG.
Free agent Roger Mason hinted in a video on Youtube.com that he could soon be joining the Knicks.
Devin Harris (strained knee) will play versus the Celtics on Sunday.
Timberwolves guard Wayne Ellington (bruised thigh) won't travel with the team for back-to-back games on Sunday and Monday.
Rajon Rondo (knee, hamstring, foot) and Shaquille O'Neal (knee) are both questionable for Wednesday's game against the Nuggets.
Raptors guard Marcus Banks did not dress for Sunday's game because of an upper respiratory infection.
The Kings are aggressively pursuing a point guard, according the Sacramento Bee.
Marcus Thornton (right quad) is probable for Friday's game at Portland.
Ronnie Price has been ruled out for Sunday due to his wrist injury.
Gilbert Arenas hit just 1-of-10 shots for seven points as the Wizards were blown out by the Raptors on Wednesday.
O.J. Mayo hit just 1-of-5 shots for three points in 24 minutes off the bench on Friday.
Manu Ginobili had 26 points, six rebounds, six assists, two steals, a block and four 3-pointers in a comeback, overtime win against the Timberwolves.
Roddy Beaubois (foot) is reportedly likely to miss another 3-4 weeks.
Brandon Jennings hit 9-of-22 shots for 25 points, four rebounds, six assists, a steal and a block in Friday's loss to the Pistons.
Raymond Felton played 53 minutes in Sunday's epic double-OT victory, admitting afterward that he was battling the flu.
Tyreke Evans scored 25 points on 11-of-20 shooting (including three 3-pointers) with five rebounds, eight assists, and a steal on Saturday.
The Hawks have reached out to free agent G Earl Boykins, a league source tells RealGM.
Ramon Sessions scored five points in 12 minutes of action on Saturday, hitting 2-of-4 shots from the field to go with no rebounds and one assist.
Daniel Gibson was held to eight points on 3-of-9 shooting (no threes) with two rebounds and one assist on Saturday.
Steve Blake (stomach virus) will not play for the Lakers on Sunday.
Pistons rookie Terrico White (broken foot) is headed for surgery on Friday.
Sasha Vujacic (concussion) could return to action on Thursday.
Jarrett Jack, David Andersen and Marcus Banks are expected to join the Hornets in L.A. on Monday for a game against the Clippers.
Jason Kidd had just three points, three rebounds, 12 assists, three steals, a block and a 3-pointer in Wednesday's win.
Memphis SG Elliot Williams did not attend this week's draft combine in Chicago because of a minor knee injury.
Greivis Vasquez (ankle) will sit out the rest of the preseason and is out of the Grizzlies' rotation.
Mike Conley had 18 points, seven rebounds, a career-high 13 assists, three steals and a 3-pointer on 6-of-13 shooting in Wednesday's loss.
The Blazers have signed second-round pick Armon Johnson.
The Jazz are said to be working out point guard Earl Watson, who played for the Pacers last season.
Eddie House hit 6-of-9 shots and three 3-pointers for 15 points in Wednesday's easy win.
Pistons guard Will Bynum (hamstring) will be a game-time decision on Friday.
Toney Douglas will miss Sunday's game against the Pistons due to a bruised thigh.
Carlos Arroyo had six points, three rebounds and one assist in Wednesday's win over the Sixers.
Gerald Henderson (knee) did not play on Monday, and there is no timetable for his return.
Baron Davis had 14 points, six rebounds and eight assists off the bench in Sunday's loss to the Blazers, logging 28 minutes.
Coach Larry Drew said that Mike Bibby is still nursing an Achilles injury.
Tony Parker hit just 4-of-12 shots for nine points, four rebounds, one assist and four turnovers in Friday's loss to the Mavericks.
Jameer Nelson (stomach virus) is considered doubtful to play on Saturday.
Landry Fields scored just seven points on 2-of-7 shooting (no threes) with two rebounds, two assists, and two steals in 30 minutes of action.
Goran Dragic (knee) will play on Thursday against the Jazz.
Ty Lawson played 22 minutes off the bench on Thursday and registered 17 points on 5-of-10 shooting with five assists and two rebounds.
Lakers veteran Derek Fisher is aware that his minutes might get cut with Steve Blake on the team.
Chauncey Billups has been activated for Sunday's game against Phoenix after missing his last couple with a wrist injury.
As expected, Monta Ellis (hip) will play against the Nuggets on Monday.
Ray Allen drained five three-pointers on his way to 20 points in Tuesday's season opener against the Heat. He was 7-of-13 from the field.
Pistons beat writer Vincent Goodwill reports that Rodney Stuckey and Richard Hamilton will start Sunday's game against the Warriors.
Anthony Parker is expected to be the starting shooting guard for the Cavs this season.
The Blazers plan on using Patty Mills on Wednesday against the Celtics.
John Wall and Al Thornton will come off the Wizards bench again on Friday.
Thunder backup guard Eric Maynor played over 30 minutes on Monday, posting two points, four rebounds and five assists.
Magic point guard Jason Williams could be challenging Chris Duhon for backup PG duties.
Joe Johnson (elbow) missed Wednesday's shootaround.
Marco Belinelli played just 22 minutes in Monday's game, scoring eight points on 2-of-5 shooting with one rebound and no assists.
Kirk Hinrich scored just nine points on 3-of-12 shooting (including two threes) with three rebounds, four assists, and a steal on Saturday.
Magic guard J.J. Redick (stomach virus) is 50-50 at best for Friday's game.
Morris Peterson, Julian Wright, and James Posey combined to shoot 3-of-20 in a blowout loss on Saturday.
Andre Miller scored 19 points on 7-of-17 shooting with two rebounds, nine assists, and five steals in Tuesday's win over the Grizzlies.
Jose Calderon had 12 points, 15 assists, four steals and two 3-pointers in Friday's loss to the Celtics.
Nate Robinson played 13 minutes despite a sore foot on Friday, finishing with five points on 2-of-6 shooting.
Eric Bledsoe returned to action on Sunday despite suffering a high ankle sprain in his previous game.
The Sixers have traded guard Willie Green and center Jason Smith to the Hornets for forwards Darius Songaila and Craig Brackins.
Shaun Livingston (knee) went through a full practice Tuesday and will play in the season opener.
The Associated Press reports that Jodie Meeks limped off with an apparent ankle injury late in Saturday's game.
Pacers rookie Lance Stephenson has been working out with the team during training camp.
Jonny Flynn made his D-League debut on Friday, notching eight points, nine assists, and six turnovers in 24 minutes.
J.J. Barea had 12 points, seven assists and a 3-pointer on 5-of-7 shooting Wednesday.
